tuv.seg: Protection of consumers of financial services
Cosaint thomhaltóirí na seirbhísí airgeadais
If you have a bank account or a loan with a financial institution, you are a consumer of financial services
Má ta cuntas bainc agat nó iasacht le hinstitiúid airgeadais, is tomhaltóir de sheirbhísí airgeadais tú
As a consumer of a financial service you have certain rights
Mar thomhaltóir de sheirbhísí airgeadais, tá cearta ar leith agat
As in other areas of consumer law, your rights as a consumer of financial services depend on the contract between you and the financial institution
Mar aon le réimse eile dlí tomhaltóra, braitheann do chuid ceart mar thomhaltóir de sheirbhísí airgeadais ar an gconradh idir tú agus an institiúid airgeadais
A contract is an agreement between two or more people that is enforceable by law
Is comhaontú idir beirt nó níos mó atá infhorghníomhaithe le dlí é conradh
As with all contracts, your contract with the financial institution consists of stated terms and implied terms
Mar aon le gach conradh, is éard atá i do chonradh leis an institiúid airgeadais ná téarmaí sonraithe agus téarmaí intuigthe
Under the European Communities (Unfair Terms in Consumer Contracts) Regulations, 1995 and subsequent amendments in 2000 any term that is found to be unfair to the consumer cannot be enforced

Faoi Rialacháin na gComhphobal Eorpach (Téarmaí Neamhfhéaráilte i gConarthaí Tomhaltóirí), 1995 agus leasúcháin iartheachtacha i 2000 ní féidir le haon téarma a fhaightear go bhfuil sé neamhfhéaráilte don tomhaltóir a bheith forghníomhaithe

From June 2010 the Consumer Credit Directive (2008/48/EC) establishes common rules on consumer credit aimed at harmonising certain aspects of the laws, regulations and administrative provisions on consumer credit in the EU

Ó Mheitheamh 2010, bunaíonn an Treoir Chreidmheas Tomhaltais (2008/48/EC) rialacha comónta ar chreidmheas tomhaltais a bhfuil sé mar aidhm acu comhchuibhiú a dhéanamh ar ghnéithe áirithe de dhlíthe, de rialacháin agus d’fhorálacha riaracháin ar chreidmheas tomhaltais san AE
The Directive covers personal loans of between €200 and €75,000 repayable after more than a month
Clúdaíonn an Treoir iasachtaí pearsanta de idir €200 agus €75,000 athiníoctha tar éis am níos faide ná mí
The Directive does not apply to mortgages or to deferred debit cards
Ní bhaineann an Treoir le morgáistí ná le cártaí dochair iarchurtha
You can find further information on the EU's Europa website
Is féidir tuilleadh eolais a fháil ar shuíomh gréasáin Europa an AE
Legislation exists that regulates financial institutions dealings with consumers such as the Consumer Credit Act 1995
Tá reachtaíocht ann cheana a rialaíonn gnóthaíocht institiúidí airgeadais le tomhaltóirí ar nós An tAcht um Chreidmheas do Thomhaltóirí, 1995
A Consumer Protection Code for financial institutions also exists that prescribes how a financial institution deals with consumers
Tá Cód d’Institiúidí Airgeadais ar Chosaint do Thomhaltóirí ann chomh maith a fhorordaíonn an chaoi a ndéileáileann insitiúidí airgeadais le tomhaltóirí
The Central Bank of Ireland is the body that enforces this code and this legislation
Is é Banc Ceannais na hÉireann an comhlacht a fhorghníomhaíonn an cód agus an reachtaíocht seo
In order to enforce your rights you need to be aware of what those rights are
Chun do chearta a fhorghníomhú, caithfidh tú a bheith feasach ar céard iad na cearta sin
The Competition and Consumer Protection Commission (CCPC) provides information to consumers on their rights and on the costs, risks and benefits of different financial products
Soláthraíonn an Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí (CCPC) eolas do thomhaltóirí ar a gcearta agus ar na costais, rioscaí agus leasanna de tháirgí airgeadais dhifriúla
This information also helps you to access the financial services that are most suitable to you
Tugann an t-eolas seo cúnamh duit freisin rochtain a fháil ar na seirbhísí airgeadais is oiriúnaí duit
The CCPC maintains financial information on its website for consumers
Coinníonn an CCPC suíomh gréasán ar eolas airgeadais do thomhaltóiri
Protection for your savings and investments
Cosaint ar do choigiltis agus ar d’infheistíochtaí
The Central Bank is responsible for the regulation of the following firms:
Tá Banc Ceannais na hÉireann freagrach as rialúchán na ngnólachtaí a leanas:
• Insurance and investment intermediaries (brokers and agents)
• Idirghabhálaithe árachais agus infheistíochta (bróicéirí agus gníomhaithe)
• Other retail credit firms
• Gnólachtaí miondíol creidmheasa eile
Before dealing with any of these firms, check that they are authorised to trade by the Central Bank
Roimh dhéileáil le haon cheann de na gnólachtaí seo, seiceáil go bhfuil siad údaraithe chun trádáil ag an mBanc Ceannais
This authorisation protects you from unscrupulous traders
Cosnaíonn an t-údarú seo tú ó thrádálaithe neamhscrupallacha
To check whether the company you are dealing with is authorised, contact the Registers Department of the Central Bank (see 'Where to apply' below)
Chun seiceáil an bhfuil an chuideachta lena bhfuil tú ag déileáil údaraithe, téigh i dteagmháil le Roinn Chlár an Bhanc Cheannais (féach ‘An áit le cur isteach air’ thíos)
There are a number of compensation schemes
Tá roinnt scéimeanna cúitimh ann

The Deposit Guarantee Scheme compensates consumers for money lost from current and deposit accounts where a bank, building or credit union is unable to return their money due to financial difficulties

Cúitíonn an Scéim Ráthaithe Taisce, bunaithe faoi Rialacháin na gComhphobal Eorpach (Scéim Ráthaithe Taisce) 1995, tomhaltóirí ar airgead a cailleadh ó chuntais reatha agus taisce, áit nach bhfuil banc, cumann forgníochta ná comhar creidmheasa in ann a n-airgead a thabhairt ar ais, mar gheall ar dheacrachtaí airgeadais. Tá an scéim seo maoinithe ag institiúidí creidmheasa údaraithe
The European Communities (Deposit Guarantee Schemes) Regulations 2015 replaces the European Communities (Deposit Guarantee Schemes) Regulations 1995 establishing the Scheme

Feidhmíonn scéim chúitimh thír AE eile i gcás bhanc nó institiúid eile údaraithe agus rialaithe i stát AE eile ach atá ag oibriú anseo ar bhonn craoibhe faoi rialacha AE, mura bhfuil sé deimhnithe ag an gcraobh do Rialaitheoir an Bhanc Cheannais go bhfuil sé ar intinn aici a bheith páirteach sa Scéim Chosanta Taiscí
The payment process is only initiated once it has been established that the institution cannot return payments made to it due to its financial condition
Tionscantar an próiseas íoctha ach amháin nuair atá sé bunaithe nach bhfuil an institiúid in ann íocaíochtaí a rinneadh a aisíoc mar gheall ar a staid airgeadais
The maximum claim per person is 100% of all deposits held by the financial institution up to a maximum of €100,000
Ó 20 Meán Fómhair 2008, is é an t-uaséileamh in aghaidh an duine ná 100% (a bhí 90%) de gach taisce a bhí á choinneáil ag an institiúid airgeadais suas go dtí uasmhéid €100,000 (a bhí €20,000)

The compensation scheme of another EU country applies in the case of a bank or financial institution authorised and regulated in another EU state but operating here on a branch basis under EU rules, unless the branch has confirmed to the Central Bank its intention to participate in the Deposit Guarantee Scheme

Ta eolas níos sonraí ar an Scéim Ráthaithe Taisce, chomh maith leis na scéimeanna bainteacha ó thíortha AE eile, ar fáil ar shuíomh gréasáin tomhaltóra an Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí (CCPC)
On 30 September 2008 the Government introduced an unlimited Government guarantee for all deposits exceeding €100,000, among other things, in certain Irish banks
Ar 30 Meán Fómhair 2008 thug an Rialtas isteach ráthaíocht neamhtheoranta Rialtais do gach taisce níos mó ná €100,000, i measc nithe eile, i mbainc Éireannacha ar leith
The scheme known as the Credit Institutions Financial Support Scheme (CIFS) expired on 29 September 2010
D’easanálaigh an scéim ar a dtugtar an Scéim Thacaíocht Airgeadais Institiúidí Creidmheasa (STAIC) ar 29 Meán Fómhair 2010
In December 2009 the Government introduced the Eligible Liabilities Guarantee Scheme (ELG) for term deposit accounts exceeding €100,000 in the same Irish banks
I mí na Nollag 2009, thug an Rialtas isteach an Scéim Ráthaíocht Fhiachais Inghlactha (SRFI) do chuntais thaiscí téarma níos mó ná €100,00 sna bainc Éireannacha céanna
The scheme covered term deposits until they matured (up to a maximum five years), provided the bank was covered by the scheme when the deposit was placed
Clúdaíonn an scéim taiscí téarma go dtí go n-aibíonn siad (suas go dtí uasmhéid cúig bliana), ar choinníoll go raibh an banc clúdaithe ag an scéim nuair a cuireadh isteach an taisce
If the bank became a member of the scheme after the deposit was placed, the deposit was covered by the CIFS Scheme until 29 September 2010
Má rinneadh ball den scéim den bhanc i ndiaidh gur cuireadh isteach an taisce, clúidaítear an taisce faoin scéim STAIC go dtí 29 Meán Fómhair 2010
The ELG scheme also covered on demand current and deposit accounts exceeding €100,000, regardless of when the deposit was placed
Chlúdaigh an scéim RFI cuntais reatha agus taisce ar éileamh a bhfuil níos mó ná €100,000 iontu, is cuma cén uair a cuireadh isteach an taisce
Notice accounts were similarly covered provided notice of withdrawl was made before the scheme ended
Clúdaítear cuntais fhógra ar an gcaoi chéanna ar an gcoinníoll go dtugtar fógra aistarraingthe roimh dar críoch an scéim
The banks covered by the two schemes were:
Is iad na bancanna abhí clúdaithe ag an dá scéim ná:
The ELG scheme ended on 28 March 2013
Chríochnaigh an scéim SRFI ar an 28 Márta 2013
If you had a fixed term deposit covered by the scheme before 28 March 2013, the protection of the scheme remains in place until the end of the term, up to a maximum of five years
Má bhí tú taisce téarma sheasta a bhí clúdaithe ag an scéim roimh 28 Márta 2013, beidh cosaint an scéim i bhfeidhm go dtí deireadh an téarma, suas go dtí uasmhéid de chúig bliana
This does not affect deposits up to €100,000 which continue to be covered by the Deposit Protection Scheme
Ní chiallaíonn sé seo taiscí difear suas le €100,000 a leanfaidh de bheith clúdaithe ag an Scéim Cosanta Taiscí
Further information on the ELG scheme is available on the CCPC's consumer website
Tá tuilleadh eolais ar scéim SRFI ar fáil ar shuíomh gréasáin tomhaltóra an CCPC
Some banks that operate in Ireland are regulated in their home country
Tá cuid de na bainc a bhíonn ag oibriú in Éirinn rialaithe ina dtír dhúchais
If you have an account in such a bank, you would usually make a claim under the compensation schemes that are in place in the country where the institution is regulated
Ma tá cuntas agat ina leithéid de bhanc, dhéanfá éileamh go hiondúil faoi na scéimeanna cúitimh atá sa tír ina bhfuil an institiúid rialaithe
The Investor Compensation Company Ltd (ICCL) operates the Investor Compensation Scheme
Oibríonn an Cuideachta Cúitimh d’Infheisteoirí Teo. (CCIT) an Scéim Chúitimh d’Infheisteoirí
The ICCL was set up under the Investor Compensation Act 1998
Cuireadh ar bun an CCIT faoin Acht um Chúiteamh d’Infheisteoirí 1998
The purpose of the Scheme is to compensate clients of failed authorised investment firms
Is í cuspóir na Scéime ná cúiteamh a dhéanamh ar chliaint de ghnólachtaí infheistithe údaraithe teipthe
If a member firm of the Scheme goes out of business and cannot return your investments or money, you may be entitled to make a claim under the scheme
Má théann ballghnólacht den Scéim as gnó agus nach féidir leo d’infheistíochtaí ná d’airgead a aisíoc, féadfaidh go mbeadh tú i dteideal éileamh a dhéanamh faoin scéim
The maximum claim per person is 90% of all deposits held by the financial institution up to a maximum of €20,000
Is é an t-uaséileamh in aghaidh an duine ná 90% de gach taisce atá á choinneáil ag an institiúid airgeadais suas go dtí uasmhéid €20,000
Further information on the Investor Compensation Scheme is available on the ICCL website
Tá tuilleadh eolais faoin Scéim Chúitimh d’Infheisteoirí ar fáil ar shuíomh gréasáin an CCIT
As a consumer, you should protect your rights and avoid dealing with unregulated financial service providers
Mar thomhaltóir, ba cheart duit do chearta a chosaint agus déileáil a sheachaint le soláthróirí seirbhísí airgeadais neamhrialaithe
Who is involved in regulation?
Cé atá bainteach le rialúchán?
The Central Bank of Ireland
Banc Ceannais na hÉireann

The arrangements for the regulation of the financial services sector have changed considerably in recent years with the most recent changes, implemented under the Central Bank Reform Act 2010, making the Central Bank of Ireland responsible for regulation

Tá athruithe suntasacha tagtha ar rialúchán an earnáil seirbhísí airgeadais le blianta beaga anuas, leis na hathruithe is déanaí, forfheidhmithe faoin Acht Athchóiriú an Bhanc Cheannais 2010, ag fágáil Banc Ceannais na hÉireann freagrach as rialúchán
The Central Bank’s Consumer Director has specific responsibility for
Tá freagracht shonrach ag Stiúrthóir Tomhaltais an Bhanc Cheannais as

• The protection of consumers and/or investors under a range of legislation including the Consumer Credit Act 1995, the Investment Intermediaries Act 1995, the Stock Exchange Act 1995, the Central Bank Act 1989 and the Insurance Act 1989

• Cosaint tomhaltóirí agus/nó infheisteoirí faoi réimse reachtaíochta ina áirítear an tAcht um Chreidmheas do Thomhaltóirí, 1995, an tAcht um Idirghábhálaithe Infheistíochta 1995, an tAcht Stocmhalartán 1995, an tAcht Bhanc Cheannais na hÉireann 1989 agus an tAcht Árachais 1989
• Monitoring the provision of financial services to consumers
• Maoirsiú a dhéanamh ar sholáthar seirbhísí airgeadais do thomhaltóirí
The Central Bank appoints the Registrar of Credit Unions who regulates credit unions
Ceapann Banc Ceannais na hÉireann an Cláraitheoir Chomhair Chreidmheasa a rialaíonn comhair chreidmheasa
The Registrar is required to inform and assist the Consumer Director in the Central Bank in relation to any complaint about a credit union
Tá ar an gCláraitheoir an Stiúrthóir Tomhaltais sa Bhanc Ceannais a chur ar an eolas agus cúnamh a thabhairt dó i ndáil le haon ghearán faoi chomhar creidmheasa
The Central Bank and Financial Services Authority of Ireland Act 2004 provides for the appointment of a statutory Financial Services Ombudsman
Foráileann an tAcht um Bhanc Ceannais agus um Údarás Seirbhísí Airgeadais na hÉireann 2004 do cheapachán Ombudsman um Sheirbhísí Airgeadais reachtúil
The scheme is financed by the providers of financial services
Maoiníonn soláthróirí seirbhísí airgeadais an scéim seo
The Ombudsman’s role is as an independent mediator dealing with individual complaints against financial services firms
Is é ról an Ombudsman ná mar eadránaí neamhspleách a dhéileáileann le gearáin aonair in aghaidh ghnóthlachtaí seirbhísí airgeadais
Complaints must first be made to the financial institution concerned and then to the Ombudsman if you are still dissatisfied
Caithfear gearáin a dhéanamh ar dtús leis an institiúid airgeadais atá i gceist agus ansin leis an Ombudsman má tá tú míshásta fós
The Ombudsman provides a mediated solution
Cuireann an tOmbudsman réiteach eadránaithe ar fáil
The Ombudsman has the power to order financial institutions to do certain things and to pay compensation
Tá an chumhacht ag an Ombudsman ordú d’institiúidí airgeadais nithe ar leith a dhéanamh agus cúiteamh a íoc
Their decisions will generally be binding on the financial institutions (subject to the right of appeal to the High Court)
Tá a gcinntí ceangailteach go ginearálta ar na hinstitiúidí airgeadais (ar choinníoll ceart achomhairc chuig an gCúirt Uachtarach)
Read more about the Financial Services Ombudsman's office here
Léigh níos mó faoi oifig an Ombudsman um Sheirbhísí Airgeadais anseo
Competition and Consumer Protection Commission
An Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí

The Competition and Consumer Protection Commission has statutory responsibility for the regulation of pawnbrokers and credit intermediaries (for example garages that offer finance on new or used cars)

Tá freagrachtaí reachtúla ag an Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí do rialúcháin gheallbhróicéirí agus idirghabhálaithe creidmheasa (mar shampla garáistí a ofráileann airgeadas ar cháirr nua agus úsáidte)
The office also monitors and investigates complaints in relation to the advertising of credit by credit intermediaries
Déanann an oifig maoirsiú chomh maith agus fiosraíonn sí gearáin i ndáil le fógraíocht creidmheasa ó idirghabhálaithe creidmheasa
FIN-NET is an EU-wide out-of-court complaints network for financial services
Is líonra gearáin as-cúirte ar fud an AE é IN-NET do sheirbhísí airgeadais

It has been designed particularly to facilitate the out-of-court resolution of consumer disputes when the service provider is established in an EU Member State other than that where the consumer lives
Tá sé deartha go háirithe chun réiteach as-cúirte d’aighnis tomhaltais a éascú nuair atá an soláthróir seirbhíse bunaithe i mBallstát AE seachas an ceann ina gcónaíonn an tomhaltóir
Financial fraud has risen in the past few years as criminals seek ways to access personal financial details
Tá calaois airgeadais ardaithe le blianta beaga anuas agus coirpigh ag cuardach bealaí chun rochtain a fháil ar shonraí pearsanta airgeadais
Personal financial details include your:
Áirítear i do shonraí pearsanta airgeadais:
• Personal identity numbers (PIN) ,
• Uimhreacha aitheantais phearsanta (UAP),
• Phone and internet banking details
• Sonraí baincéireachta idirlín agus teileafóin
It is very important that you disclose your personal financial details only to reputable traders
Tá sé an-tábhachtach nach nochtann tú do shonraí pearsanta airgeadais ach do thrádálaithe creidiúnacha amháin
Criminals have been known to access your personal financial details by impersonating your bank
Tá sé aitheanta go bhfaigheann coirpigh rochtainn ar do shonraí pearsanta airgeadais trí aithris a dhéanamh ar do bhanc
Beware of unsolicited letters, e-mails and telephone calls you receive asking you to confirm your personal financial details
Fainic litreacha, ríomhphoist agus glaoanna teileafóin gan iarraidh a fhaigheann tú a iarrann ort do shonraí pearsanta airgeadais a dheimhniú
If you receive a letter stating that you have won money from a company that you have never heard of before they may be looking for bank account details
Má fhaigheann tú litir ag rá go bhfuil airgead buaite agat ó chomhlacht nár chuala tú trácht riamh air, d’fhéadfaí go bhfuil siad ag cuardach sonraí cuntais bhainc
Never write your personal identity number (PIN) down
Ná scríobh d’uimhir aitheantais phearsanta síos riamh
In particular, do not keep this number with your bankcards - memorise it
Go háirithe, ná coinnigh an uimhir seo le do chártaí bainc – foghlaim de ghlanmheabhair í
Never disclose your PIN to anyone - your PIN is personal information that your bank would never ask you to state
Ná nocht d’UAP d’aon duine – is eolas pearsanta atá san UAP nach n-iarrfadh do bhanc ort riamh é a lua
Your bank may ask you to input your pin to your phone or a PIN terminal at your bank branch or ATM
D’fhéadfaí go n-iarrfadh do bhanc ort d’UAP a chur isteach i do theileafón nó teirminéal UAP ag do chraobh bhainc nó UMB
If you have difficulty memorising your PIN you can change it to a number that you can remember
Má tá deacracht agat d’UAP a chur de ghlanmheabhair is féidir leat í a athrú chuig uimhir ar féidir leat smaoineamh uirthi
Avoid memorising a number that a criminal might be able to guess - such as a birthday
Seachain uimhir ar féidir le coirpeach í a thomhas – ar nós lá breithe
Changing your PIN is easy to do at an Automatic Teller Machine (ATM) or at the bank counter
Tá sé éasca UAP a athrú ag Uathmheasín Bainc (UMB) nó ag an gcúntar bainc
Report any lost or stolen cards as soon as you notice them missing
Déan tuairisc ar chártaí caillte nó goidte a luaithe agus a aithníonn tú go bhfuil siad ar iarraidh
If you don’t you may be liable for purchases made fraudulently on your card
Mura ndéanann d’fhéadfaí go mbeifeá faoi dhliteanas do cheannacháin déanta go calaoiseach ar do chárta
The best way to protect yourself from fraud is to keep your cards and personal financial details secure
Is é an bealach is fearr chun tú féin a chosaint ó chalaois ná do chártaí agus do shonraí pearsanta airgeadais a choinneáil slán
In the case of credit cards, a new service - chip and PIN - has been introduced to make credit cards more secure
I gcás cártaí creidmheasa, tá seirbhís nua – slis agus UAP – tugtha isteach chun cártaí creidmheasa a dhéanamh níos sláine
If you have a chip and PIN facility on your card (a gold coloured computer chip will be visible on your card) you type in a PIN into the retailers machine instead of signing dockets
Má tá saoráid shlis agus UAP ar do chárta (beidh slis ríomhaire ar dhath an óir feiceálach ar do charta) clóscríobhann tú UAP isteach i meaisín an mhiondíoltóra in áit duillíní a shíniú
Never use your credit card PIN or other PIN on the internet or over the phone
Ná húsáid d’UAP cárta creidmheasa ná aon UAP eile riamh ar an idirlíon ná ar an teileafón
A frequent financial services scam is where sales persons use high-pressure sales tactics over the telephone, by mail or in person
Is camscéim sheirbhísí airgeadais go minic í nuair a úsáideann díoltóirí taicticí díolacháin d’ardbhrú ar an teileafón, tríd an bpost nó go pearsanta
These scams are called ‘boiler rooms operations’ where the sales person put you under pressure to buy worthless or high-risk shares, foreign currency or other investments
Tugtar ‘oibríochtaí seomra coire’ áit a gcuireann an díoltóir faoi bhrú tú chun scaranna gan luach nó d’ardriosca, airgeadra eachtrannach nó infheistíochtaí a cheannach
If you are offered an investment deal, check if the financial institution is authorised by the Central Bank by phoning Lo-Call 1890 777 777
Má ofráiltear idirbheart infheistíochta duit, seiceáil an bhfuil an institiúid airgeadais údaraithe ag an mBanc Ceannais trí ghlaoch a chur ar Íos-Ghlao 1890 777 777
Particular laws exist to protect you if you are buying products and services by distance selling
Tá dlíthe áirithe ann chun tú a chosaint má cheannaíonn tú táirgí agus seirbhísí trí chiandíol
There are also laws that deal with unsolicited commercial email which can help to ensure that your personal details remain private
Tá dlíthe ann freisin a dhéileáileann le ríomhphoist thráchtála gan iarraidh ar féidir leo cinntiú go bhfanann do shonraí pearsanta príomhaideach
